activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges and 57 days credit. Costs waived.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas S Lawver

records.addlTxt: From RCSD; Count 2

1:30 PM 22CF82/22CF126 - Defendant Nicholas S Lawver in court.  Attorney Nicholas Frederick Gansner in court for Nicholas S Lawver.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  

22CF82 - Court speaks about the motion to revoke a diversion agreement. Court states that NL need to continue to make monthly payment of $100 per month. 
22CF126 - Attorney Gansner has received the complaint. Max penalties stated. Attorney Gansner waives the formal reading. 

Attorney Forehand asks that the motion be heard at the same time of the preliminary hearing if contested. Attorney Gansner states that they will be contesting this base on the text message only. 

Attorney Forehand heard regarding bail condition and contact with children.

Attorney Gansner waives the time limits for a preliminary hearing.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Motion hearing on December 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Attachment to Motion to revoke DPA
Motion hearing on October 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

8/31/22 - Court admits Defendant to a signature bond with the same conditions as previously ordered including no contact with the victim, victim's residence, or the children, and to stay 5 miles away from the residence. If any conditions of bond are proposed to change, counsel have been directed to present the Court with a written stipulation for the Court's consideration.

(This bond, in effect during term of DPA, has been forwarded to the RCSD for the Defendant's signature. 9/1/22 sk)

2:07 PM 22CF82, 22CM14, 22CM45, and 22CM82 for plea/sentencing. Defendant Nicholas S Lawver in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas Frederick Gansner in court for Nicholas S Lawver.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties' plea agreement detailed by Atty. Lawver. Court's colloquy with Def re pleas. Def pleads guilty to the following charges:

Stalking, count 1, 22CF82; bail jumping, count 2, 22CF82
Disorderly conduct with domestic abuse enhancer, count 1, 22CM14
Disorderly conduct with domestic abuse enhancer, count 1 and criminal damage to property, count 2, 22CM83

Court finds Def guilty of the counts stated and enters JOC on all but the stalking count, count 1 of 22CF82. For that matter, Court will approve the 2-year DPA that's been proposed.

Remaining counts to be DRI. Party's agreement calls for forfeiting of $1000 cash bond in 22CM45 and forfeiting of $150 bond in 22CM14. Bond in 22CM83 not to be forfeited. State is requesting $1450 restitution for the victim. 

Def will remain on bond during the DPA in 22CF82. Discussion re the conditions, particularly the distance prohibition.

Court rules on sentence:

22CM14 - disorderly conduct and 22CM83 disorderly conduct and damage to property - sentence withheld for 2 years probation. No contact with the victim unless agreed upon by both victim and probation agent. Def must participate in any counseling or treatment as recommended by agent and follow all rules of probation. Def to participate in and pay for psych. evaluation and follow up treatment recommended. Court orders restitution in 22CM83 of $1450, payable to the Clerk of Court, to be removed from the posted bond. Restitution is not a condition of probation.

22CM14 - $150 bail forfeited, by stipulation of the parties.

22CM45 DRI, however, in that case, $1000 bail forfeited, by stipulation of the parties.

22CF82 - misdemeanor bail jumping - 5 mo jail sentence imposed. Def is granted Huber privileges. Credit: 57 days. 
22CF82 - stalking - Court approves the 2 year diversion agreement when presented/filed.

Court orders 1 set of misdemeanor court costs, to be entered in 22CM83. Domestic abuse surcharges to be entered for both dc charges with d.a. enhancers. 

For DPA, Court admits Def to signature bond with the same conditions as previously ordered (5 mile prohibition). If parties reach a stipulation for something different, they may propose it to the court at a later date.

1:13 PM 2022CM000014, 2022CM000045, 2022CM000083Defendant Nicholas S Lawver appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nicholas Frederick Gansner appeared by video for Nicholas S Lawver.  Attorney Gansner has received the information, waives the formal reading and enters a NG plea. Attorney Forehand will be sending an offer soon.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Judge McDougal has granted permission for Atty Gansner to appear by zoom for all 4 cases. 22CM14, 22CM45, 22CM83 and
22CF82
to Appear Remotely

9:18 AM 22CF82/ 22CM14/ 22CM45/ 22CM83 - Defendant Nicholas S Lawver in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nicholas Frederick Gansner in court for Nicholas S Lawver.  Attorney Gansner states that they are prepared to move forward with the preliminary hearing on 22CF82. Attorney Forehand calls Officer Tucker. Sworn and testimony given. Crossed by Attorney Gansner. Redirect by Attorney Forehand. 

Attorney Forehand and Attorney Gansner speak. Court binds over for trial. Bail will continue.
Arraignment scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment on August 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
For Zoom

Granted.

Court orders that the defendant pay monthly payments of $100; once release from jail. Defendant must fill out the payment plan form.

At the end of the case, Defendant will be required to fully reimburse Richland County. Failure to pay will result in collection actions by the clerk.

1:34 PM 2022CM000045, 2022CM000083, 2022CF82 - Defendant Nicholas S Lawver in court, in custody.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gansner appears in person for 22CM83. NL states that he has filled out the application for dean appointment. Court will appoints an attorney for the defendant. Court orders that the defendant pay monthly payment of $100; once release from jail. Defendant must fill out the payment plan form. Court appoints Attorney Gansner in 22CF82 and 22CM83.

Attorney Gansner's speaks about the multiple attorneys in the cases.

Attorney Forehand doesn't feel that the bail forfeit are needed at this time. Attorney Gansner concurs.

Court removes the jury trial dates from the calendar and allows Attorney Gansner to appear by video.
Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
for Zoom
No contact with victim, her residence, or the children. Def to stay 5 miles away from the residence.

11:01 AM Defendant Nicholas S Lawver in court, in custody.  Attorney Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Harper speaks about the defendant wants a dean appointment and review of bail. NL speaks about multiple attorneys on his other cases. Court speaks to the defendant about his other cases/attorneys. Attorney Harper speaks that at the prior hearing Judge Kirchman has asks NL to fill out the petition which he has done. NL has spoken to the public defenders office. 

Attorney Harper states that NL is on the a $10,000 cash bond. NL speaks. 

Court goes over the petition for dean appointment. NL speaks about employment to the court. Attorney Harper speaks about inaccuracy of the application. (rent and child support)  NL comments.

Court ask if there is any amount of bail that NL can afford. Attorney Harper objects to a cash bond being converted to a signature bond. Attorney Harper asks for an a additional 5 feet away from the residence.

Court will not modify the bail. Judge McDougal asks the NL to call the public defender office and states to them that you can't post bond and can't work due to being in jail. 

Court amends the bond to add the that defendant should not be within 5 miles of the victims residence. 

State indicate that they will be filing a motion to forfeit bond on the other cases. Court states that this will be heard on 07/19/22 at 1:30 PM.
Hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
For the Victim to appear by Zoom

records.addlTxt:
2:33 PM Defendant Nicholas S Lawver in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gansner appears by video. Attorney Chirafisi appears by video. Attorney Gansner speaks about the status of the attorney of the case. Attorney Chirafisi states that he isn't in the position to have an attorney in the felony case.

Attorney Forehand states that the older case are set for jury trial.
22CF825 - Defendant was given the complaint in court and max penalties were stated. Court speaks about counsel. Defendant need to fill out the application for dean appointment. NL asks for a signature bond instead of a cash bond. Court states that a motion needs to be filed to change or amend bond. 

Attorney Forehand speaks about joining all the cases to make a possible resolution or all would go to trial. Attorney Chirafisi speaks about completing the preliminary hearing first and then speak about joining all cases. Court isn't against a continuance of the jury trial to September. 
Parties are in agreement to move the jury trial to September for CM cases. Final Status - 08/29/22 at 11 AM and Jury Selection for 09/06/22 at 9 AM
Preliminary hearing in 22CF82 for 07/22/22 at 10 AM, motion to modify bond and application for dean appointment would be  heard on 07/15/22 at 11 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing on July 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No contact with victim, her residence, or the children. Def to stay at least 2500 feet away from the residence.

3:01 p.m. Appearances by ADA Amy Forehand for the State; Defendant in custody, appearing by video from the Richland County Jail, represented by Attorney Nicholas Gansner for this hearing, Atty. Gansner appearing by separate video. Atty. Forehand addressed the Court re the charges that were the basis for the arrest. State requests $10,000 cash bond with conditions of no contact with the victim, her residence, or her children. Atty. Gansner argues for the Defense; asks for lower cash bond if cash bond is ordered. Court orders $6000 cash bond with conditions of "No contact with victim, her residence, or the children. Def to stay at least 2500 feet away from the residence." July 13 at 2:30 for the initial.
